title: Flattened Syrian City Of Homs Is Scene Of Devastation
teaser: In the Syrian city of Homs, things are quieter than they have been after rebels retreated in a U.N.-brokered ceasefire. Steve Inskeep talks to Time magazine's Ayrn Baker, who was recently in Homs.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
